definitions: liability to change rapidly and unpredictably, especially for the worse

examples.text: the succession of new rulers contributed to the volatility of the situation
a week of historic stock market volatility

shortDefinitions: liability to change rapidly and unpredictably

definitions: liability to display rapid changes of emotion

examples.text: the children have been exposed to the full force of her volatility

shortDefinitions: liability to display rapid changes of emotion

definitions: tendency of a substance to evaporate at normal temperatures

examples.text: the volatility of chemicals in an indoor environment

shortDefinitions: tendency of substance to evaporate at normal temperatures
